content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>The University of Southern Mississippi Department of Marine Science,Stennis Space Center, Mississippi, USA </origin> <pubdate>Unpublished material </pubdate> <title>Central Gulf of Mexico Ocean Observing System(CenGOOS): Novatel GPS Data </title> <onlink>http://www.cengoos.org </onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>Novatel GPS sensor determines the position of the buoy. </abstract> <purpose>Measure the position of the buoy. </purpose> <supplinf>GPS Receiver Model Number: OEM4-G2GPS Antenna Model Number: GPS-700GPS Reciever Serial Number: UnknownGPS Antenna Serial Number: UnknownLast Calibrated: N/ALast Field Calibration Check: 11/2004Date/time frequency of collected observation: 1 Hz, decimatal to half hourly </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>20041213 </begdate> <enddate>20050829 </enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>Observed </current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete </progress> <update>Eight times daily </update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-88.647642 </westbc> <eastbc>-88.646922 </eastbc> <northbc>30.042733 </northbc> <southbc>30.042103 </southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>MEL Keyword Thesauri </themekt> <themekey>Oceanographic </themekey> <themekey>Meteorological </themekey> <themekey>Buoy </themekey> <themekey>Remote Sensing </themekey> <themekey>Mooring </themekey> <themekey>Oceanographic Sensors </themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>Mel Keyword Thesauri </placekt> <placekey>Gulf of Mexico, Mississippi Sound, Mississippi Bight </placekey> </place> <temporal> <tempkt>MEL Keyword Thesauri </tempkt> <tempkey>2004 (limited), 2005, present </tempkey> </temporal> </keywords> <accconst>None.  Its is strongly recommended that the USM3m01 buoy data bedirectly acquired from the Department of Marine Science,University of Southern Mississippi and not indirectly throughother sources as they might have been changed. </accconst> <useconst>Principle Investigators (Originators), University of SouthernMississippi Department of Marine Science, and the Grantors(See Data_Set_Credit) should be fully acknowledged in anypublication in which any part of these data are used.  Use ofthe data without completely reading and understanding of themetadata is not recommended.  The Department of Marine Science,University of Southern Mississippi is not responsible for themisuse of data. </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Dr. Stephan Howden, Jamie Davis </cntper> <cntorg>Department of Marine ScienceThe University of Southern Mississippi </cntorg> </cntperp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing Address </addrtype> <address>1020 Balch Blvd. </address> <city>Stennis Space Center </city> <state>MS </state> <postal>39529 </postal> <country>USA </country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>228-688-2575 </cntvoice> <cntfax>228-688-1121 </cntfax> <cntemail>j.davis@usm.edu </cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>The CenGOOS project is funded by NOAA and ONR, with Drs. Stephan Howden,Steve Lohrenz, Don Roman, and Vernon Asper as Principal Investigators.Numerous researchers, faculty, post-docs, technicians, students and datamanagers have contributed to these datasets. </datacred> <native>The raw and decoded data from USM3m01 buoy are stored in amySAL database on a Linux Server and served via Internet. </native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>GPS Position Accuracy: (1-2)x10-4 degreesGPS Position Precision: (1-2)x10-4 degrees </attraccr> </attracc> <logic>N/A </logic> <complete>The near-time data from the USM3m01 buoy can be accessed viathe website at http://www.cengoos.org.  The station data isupdated every half hour.  Various data displays, includingwind vectors for one week, air and sea surface temperaturesfor one week, near surface salinity for one week and relativehumidity for one week are also available for download fromthe website.  For further details on data availability andaccess, please contact CenGOOS program data manager. </complete> <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc>The data processing steps used by CenGOOS will be briefly outlined here. More details are available at the Department of Marine Science(DMS) at The University of Southern Mississippi (USM).The primary data telemetry system using a Qualcomm Globalstar modem.The buoy calls a data server at USM/DMS every three hours to uploadthe half-hourly data. If necessary, the buoy can be set totemporarily dial in every half-hour.  Service ARGOS is used as a back-up telemetry system. The USM/DMS data server uses Perl scripts to: 1)load the data into a database that is accessible to the CenGOOS webserver; 2) ftp's the data to the Geophysical and EnvironmentalResearch Group (GREG) at Texas A"&"M; and 3) ftp's the data to the NOAA/National Data Buoy Center. The data from the CenGOOS webserver is available at http://www.cengoos.org. The most recent observations,plots of data from the past five days, and access to the data archives are available at that web site. </procdesc> <procdate>Unknown </procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres>0.0002  </latres> <longres>0.0002  </longres> <geogunit>Decimal degrees </geogunit> </geograph> <geodetic> <horizdn>WGS84 </horizdn> <ellips>GRS80 </ellips> <semiaxis>6378137.0 </semiaxis> <denflat>298.257222101 </denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Dr. Stephan Howden, Jamie Davis </cntper> <cntorg>Department of Marine ScienceThe University of Southern Mississippi </cntorg> </cntperp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing address </addrtype> <address>1020 Balch Blvd. </address> <city>Stennis Space Center </city> <state>MS </state> <postal>39529 </postal> <country>USA </country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>228-688-2575 </cntvoice> <cntfax>228-688-1121 </cntfax> <cntemail>j.davis@usm.edu </cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <distliab>No liability is assumed </distliab> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20050622 </metd> <metrd>20050622 </metrd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Dr. Stephan Howden, Jamie Davis </cntper> <cntorg>Department of Marine ScienceThe University of Southern Mississippi </cntorg> </cntperp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing address </addrtype> <address>1020 Balch Blvd. </address> <city>Stennis Space Center </city> <state>MS </state> <postal>39529 </postal> <country>USA </country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>228-688-2575 </cntvoice> <cntfax>228-688-1121 </cntfax> <cntemail>j.davis@usm.edu </cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata </metstdn> <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998 </metstdv> <mettc>Universal Time </mettc> </metainfo> </metadata>
